#summary Introduction to the Java Client Library
#labels Featured

= Getting started with the Java Client Library =

== List of restful endpoints you can use to test the library ==
  * http://sandbox.orkut.com/social/rest

== Sample code ==
{{{
import java.util.Collection;

import org.opensocial.data.*;
import org.opensocial.client.*;

public class Main {

  /**
   * @param args
   */
  public static void main(String[] args) {
    OpenSocialClient c = new OpenSocialClient();
    c.setProperty(OpenSocialClient.Property.RESTFUL_BASE_URI, "http://sandbox.orkut.com/social/rest/");
    c.setProperty(OpenSocialClient.Property.TOKEN, <ORKUT_TOKEN>);


    try {
      OpenSocialPerson p = c.fetchPerson("01495306580392390900");
      OpenSocialField f = p.getField("thumbnailUrl");
      System.out.println(f.getStringValue());

      Collection<OpenSocialPerson> friends = c.fetchFriends("01495306580392390900");
      for (OpenSocialPerson friend : friends) {
        System.out.println(friend.getDisplayName());
      }

      OpenSocialObject o = c.fetchPersonAppData("01495306580392390900", "291092957065");
      System.out.println(o.getField("test").getStringValue());

    } catch (Exception e) {

    }
  }

}

}}}
